channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: Anguished parents were instructed to stay away from the school that was the site of the mass shooting in Uvalde, Texas. They were told to gather at the Uvalde Civic Center “for reunification” as students were still being accounted for. https://t.co/WkiKZcA9jI https://t.co/N8IN3VvYxU

Parents waited, hoping to be reunited with their children in Uvalde, Texas, on Tuesday.
It is a small, working-class city about 80 miles west of San Antonio, in a region with a large Mexican American population. https://t.co/HtTCsLVp64 https://t.co/kPDfJS8Bi7

Vice President Kamala Harris addressed the shooting in Uvalde, Texas, on Tuesday, speaking at an event in Washington, D.C.: "Our hearts keep getting broken." https://t.co/v1UdvHMv5e https://t.co/Dz80owqpae
Stacey Abrams has won the Democratic nomination for governor of Georgia. Her first run, against Brian Kemp in 2018, propelled her to political stardom. https://t.co/5oX0cgk4VB
The U.S. is in the middle of a gun-buying boom that shows no sign of letting up as the annual number of firearms manufactured has nearly tripled since 2000. https://t.co/NmSvXUr4aj

The massacre at Robb Elementary School in Uvalde comes as a trial is underway for the gunman in the 2018 shooting at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida, where a former student killed 17 people and injured 17 others.
Live updates: https://t.co/gna5H65ogR

“Today is a dark day,” Senator Ted Cruz said in a statement after the shooting in Uvalde, Texas. He did not immediately call for any policy proposals to curb mass shootings and is scheduled to speak at the NRA’s annual meeting in Houston on Friday. https://t.co/F8qiulrknI

President Biden ordered the flags lowered on federal buildings in honor of the victims of the school shooting in Uvalde, Texas. He will deliver remarks at 8:15 p.m. Eastern when he returns from a trip abroad, White House officials said. https://t.co/YcgYLxI982

The massacre in Uvalde, Texas, which killed 14 students and a teacher, is the deadliest shooting at an elementary school since the shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary School in 2012 that killed 20 first graders and six adults in Newtown, Connecticut. https://t.co/cmFmNfTdGG https://t.co/5hfl3cGJkS

Anguished parents were instructed to stay away from the school that was the site of the mass shooting in Uvalde, Texas. A message on the district website said, “Students need to be accounted for before they are released to your care.” https://t.co/2xWhSmG2Hm

Gov. Greg Abbott of Texas, along with Donald Trump and Senator Ted Cruz, is scheduled to speak at the NRA's annual meeting in Houston on Friday, three days after the mass shooting in Uvalde, Texas, that has left at least 14 children and one teacher dead. https://t.co/S8q5cDzfkJ

May 24: Uvalde, Texas May 14: Buffalo
The massacre in Uvalde, in which 14 children and a teacher were killed, was the deadliest mass shooting in the U.S. this year. It happened just 10 days after 10 people were killed in a Buffalo supermarket. https://t.co/JFDWZQHB7f

A gunman walked into an elementary school in Uvalde, Texas, on Tuesday afternoon and killed 14 children and a teacher, Gov. Greg Abbott said on Tuesday. The last day of school was to be this Thursday. https://t.co/hiGgECcKLa https://t.co/L5bMvEhyUg
Breaking News: A gunman killed 14 children and a teacher at an elementary school in Uvalde, Texas, Gov. Greg Abbott said. The 18-year-old suspect was also killed. https://t.co/5zJTcrL1NK

Russia’s depleted military is running out of time to break through in Ukraine’s east.
See how the scope of the invasion has changed. https://t.co/Vgtb7c6sJb
Breaking News: A shooting at an elementary school in Uvalde, Texas, left at least two people dead and more than a dozen children injured. https://t.co/2ktFxhNrzx

Stacey Abrams, who is running for governor in Georgia, declined to comment on racist remarks made by David Perdue. "I have listened to Republicans for the last six months attack me, but they've done nothing to attack the challenges facing Georgia." https://t.co/S2RXWPH9ve https://t.co/u0kR6K75YG

In 1914, eight U.S. marines strolled into the headquarters of Haiti's national bank and walked out with $500,000 in gold.
The operation was a precursor to the full-scale invasion of Haiti — a country the U.S. ruled with brute force for 19 years. https://t.co/M2u8Jv9BNJ

A Moscow court upheld an additional nine-year sentence in a high-security prison for the opposition leader Aleksei Navalny.
“This war, just like your courts, is totally built on lies,” he said of the war in Ukraine, according to Russian journalists. https://t.co/xzY5wSTZeR https://t.co/LsuDe8xpsY

About 15 million more people died than expected across the world in the first two years of the pandemic, according to the WHO. These estimates are what many scientists say are the most reliable gauge of the total impact of the pandemic so far. https://t.co/NUO4CilpQz https://t.co/bgKdzfKtKn

American-made M777 howitzers are the most lethal weapons the West has provided so far to Ukraine. Their recent arrival has buoyed the Ukrainian military’s hopes of achieving artillery superiority over Russia. https://t.co/9eR7kLGvTh

In 1914, eight U.S. marines strolled into the headquarters of Haiti's national bank and walked out with $500,000 in gold.
The operation was a precursor to the full-scale invasion of Haiti — a country the U.S. ruled with brute force for 19 years. https://t.co/KvGfN52KB4

New York lawmakers on Monday passed the Adult Survivors Act, which enables adult victims of sexual abuse a one-time opportunity to file civil lawsuits even if any statutes of limitations have run out. Gov. Kathy Hochul is expected to sign the bill. https://t.co/qshaKDlf2i

Across the world, about 15 million more people died than expected in the first two years of the pandemic. These latest estimates by the WHO are what many scientists consider the most reliable gauge of the total impact of the pandemic so far. https://t.co/DX5Huh5VMK

Many Black families in Buffalo remain fearful after ten people were killed in a racist mass shooting on May 14. Simier Sweet, 13, said he was nervous about walking to the bus stop alone. “It could happen on the bus, anywhere, me walking to my school.” https://t.co/7NKlaeutRz

President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine called on world leaders at the World Economic Forum on Monday to turn up the pressure on Russia.
“This is really the moment when it is decided whether brute force will rule the world,” he said. https://t.co/hrTfjO2pFO

Weeks before the Trump administration ended, Jared Kushner and Steven Mnuchin met with future investors on trips to the Middle East. The travels raise questions about whether they sought to exploit relationships with foreign leaders for business interests. https://t.co/YrCk9gDOBJ

A bank that helped finance the Eiffel Tower drained millions of dollars from Haiti. That history has been all but erased — but The New York Times tracked the money. https://t.co/ENGhtyXTLZ https://t.co/2RMVTahs34

Congressional ethics investigators said they have found "substantial evidence" that Rep. Ronny Jackson, Republican of Texas and the former White House doctor to Donald Trump, improperly used campaign donations to pay for access to a private dining club. https://t.co/TOHWNB4Y5b

Former Senator David Perdue ended his campaign for governor of Georgia with a racist appeal to Republican primary voters on Monday, accusing Stacey Abrams, the presumptive Democratic nominee, of “demeaning her own race.” https://t.co/ssmUGezsq5

Addressing the World Economic Forum, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine called on Monday for tougher sanctions against Russia and invited international companies shunning Russia to set up shop in Ukraine. https://t.co/3677KuNNKL https://t.co/5FTBx0Zim8
A bank that helped finance the Eiffel Tower drained millions of dollars from Haiti. That history has been all but erased — but The New York Times tracked the money. https://t.co/RTz7dZD28k

Russians invited guests to the Russia House at Switzerland's World Economic Forum for years. A Ukrainian has now changed it to the "Russian War Crimes House" to rally people at the annual event to commit to the business of arming and rebuilding Ukraine. https://t.co/1R6Xq1a56X

Breaking News: President Biden will begin an economic bloc with a dozen Asia-Pacific nations meant to counter China and reassert U.S. influence in the region. The alliance comes five years after Donald Trump’s withdrawal from the Trans-Pacific Partnership. https://t.co/Q9LEaovLOL

Customs agents in Detroit intercepted the larvae and pupae of an unidentified insect inside seed pods in a passenger’s luggage. The insect turned out to be a species of moth not seen since 1912, officials said. https://t.co/AZkNeK7x8G
Starbucks announced on Monday that it was officially exiting its business in Russia, closing 130 stores there and halting the shipment of any Starbucks products. https://t.co/K2AixC2aTw

Au 19ème siècle, le Crédit Industriel et Commercial, la banque qui aida à financer la tour Eiffel, a soutiré des millions de francs à Haïti. Cette histoire est quasi gommée des mémoires — mais le New York Times a enquêté sur les paiements. https://t.co/mJQmExkMBf

President Volodymyr Zelensky, addressing the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, invited business leaders whose companies are leaving Russia to bring their firms to Ukraine to help rebuild his country. https://t.co/TV1uaCa2Tw https://t.co/KyYA3PU22U

Breaking News: A Russian diplomat resigned over the Ukraine invasion, describing it as a crime.
“Never have I been so ashamed of my country,” he said. https://t.co/wTEGNYQ1VK

President Biden said the U.S. would use military force to defend Taiwan if China attacked, appearing to step away from a policy of “strategic ambiguity” and repeating even more unequivocally statements that his staff tried to walk back in the past. https://t.co/uIoK63VSeH https://t.co/X98M3ri4jl

A bank that helped finance the Eiffel Tower, one of the world’s best known landmarks, drained millions of dollars from Haiti. That history has been all but erased — but The New York Times tracked the money.
Here’s what to know. https://t.co/xx7fmMzEvR https://t.co/wyPgLKoo6i

Haiti is the only country in the world where descendants of enslaved people were forced to pay reparations to descendants of its masters for generations.
Nobody knew exactly how much Haiti paid France — and at what cost to its future — until now. https://t.co/mjv4pbxJWD

Lara Logan’s path has been one of the most puzzling in TV news history — CBS News once saw her as a next-generation star, but she now promotes far-right falsehoods and conspiracies. Former colleagues say her transformation did not come out of nowhere. https://t.co/BjP0Db7PPr
Breaking news: President Biden said the U.S. would defend Taiwan militarily if China invaded, appearing to step away from a policy of “strategic ambiguity.” https://t.co/tSqWNtucPI

By collecting, melting, reforming and packaging partially used soap left behind by hotel guests, Clean The World has distributed nearly 70 million bars of soap in more than 120 countries — including Romania, where many Ukrainian refugees have arrived. https://t.co/oZf12MCnGC

After a man from Conklin, N.Y., was charged with the mass killing at a Buffalo grocery store, the community where he grew up has been forced to wrestle with hard questions about how such hate could have percolated in one of their neighbors. https://t.co/71rvbLHqkv

Weeks before the Trump administration ended, Jared Kushner and Steven Mnuchin met with future investors on trips to the Middle East. The travels raise questions about whether they sought to exploit relationships with foreign leaders for business interests. https://t.co/KflAktROxt https://t.co/SrNHp1W4Ph
Kate McKinnon, Pete Davidson and Aidy Bryant each got to take a victory lap in the “Saturday Night Live” season finale. https://t.co/s9XrPJjLF5

In a visit to Kyiv on Sunday, Poland's president said Ukraine alone should determine its future and that the international community must demand Russia’s complete withdrawal from its territory. https://t.co/KCH0vXl15u https://t.co/MU7lTLSqhI

In a sign of growing concern about the spread of new coronavirus infections, the CDC is now saying that all people 50 or older should get a second booster shot if at least four months have passed since their first booster dose. https://t.co/2G25x4QEmX
